column4: im trying to get java working in the opera browser.  Will i have more luck downloading the rpm.bin?  or just the .bin (self extracting file)?
i know rpm + alien = .deb
can i work with bin files easily?
how easy is it to work with bin files on ubuntu?
how can i get java working in the opera browser?
i guess i am confused as to where java installs.  into the OS, or into the browser?
java installs in the OS in /usr/lib/java but there is also a browser plugin. When you use a web page that has java on it, it uses the browser plugin which relies on the copy of java on the system.
thank you
doc_brown:You can also run java programs such as limewire, or jbidwatcher directly on the OS, using the copy of java that is installed on the system

or you need to get opera to use the current plugin. There is usually a list of plugin paths. I.E. seach /usr/lib/mozilla /usr/lib/firefox, ~/.mozilla, etc.
or you can copy the plugin into the opera plugins folder, either the system wide one your the one in your home directory.
